title: Jennifer Aniston insists Steve Carell's Morning Show anchor is not based on Matt Lauer
text:
She stars in Apple TV's original series The Morning Show, playing a veteran anchor who finds herself in the spotlight when her male colleague is fired over sexual misconduct allegations.

But Jennifer Aniston is insisting, as she does publicity for the comedy-drama, that Steve Carell's character Mitch Kessler isn't based on disgraced Today show anchor Matt Lauer.

Rather, the former Friends star told Variety, Kessler is 'the archetype of a charming narcissist, of a generation of men that didn’t think that was bad behavior.'

Distance: Jennifer Aniston insists the disgraced TV anchor in her Apple TV series The Morning Show isn't based on Matt Lauer even though the pilot was rewritten after Lauer's 2017 firing

Fiction vs fact: Steve Carell's Morning Show character Mitch Kessler, left, is fired over sexual misconduct allegations; Lauer, right, was fired from NBC's Today for the same reason

Aniston's disavowal comes despite the fact that the original pilot for The Morning Show was completely re-worked following Lauer's firing in 2017 and even though she acknowledges watching tapes of him as she was developing the project.

'The show got picked up. We sold it to Apple with an outline. Then, about four months later, the whole s— hit the fan and, basically, we had to start from scratch,' she explained.

Aniston is a co-executive producer on the show along with her co-star Reese Witherspoon.

Witherspoon stars as a local newswoman who joins Aniston's character as co-anchor of the network morning show and the streaming service commissioned two seasons straight off the bat.

A-listers: Aniston is a veteran co-anchor whose disgraced male colleague is replaced by a local newswoman played by Reese Witherspoon in the comedy-drama

As a Hollywood A-lister thanks to her hit NBC sitcom and a slew of movie roles, the 50-year-old star had been a frequent guest on Today during the Lauer era.

'I was so devastated,' Aniston said about learning of the sexual misconduct allegations against Lauer.

'It’s such a strange thing; it felt oddly like my dad did something terrible. I trusted him and had been interviewed by him,' she told Variety.

'He was there for so many moments in my life. And when ‘Friends’ was ending, it was Katie [Couric] and Matt interviewing us.'

She went on: 'I went to the DVR that I had of “Today” before Matt Lauer was fired and then the day he was fired, because that was so fascinating to see.'

'Did he know? Did he not know?'

Disgraced anchor: Lauer was part of the Today Show team from January 6, 1997 to November 28, 2017: he's pictured with weatherman Al Roker, co-host Katie Couric and co-host Ann Curry

As for returning to a small screen series after so many years, Aniston said: 'It wasn’t until the last couple of years when these streaming services were just sort of exploding with this amount of quality that I actually started to think, “Wow, that’s better than what I just did.”'

'And then you’re seeing what’s available out there and it’s just diminishing and diminishing in terms of, it’s big Marvel movies. Or things that I’m not just asked to do or really that interested in living in a green screen.'

The Morning Show is slated to premiere on Apple TV Plus on November 1.
